00056 inline bool S_ISLNK(unsigned short d)  { return (d & S_IFLNK) != 0; }

00071 // Windows
00072 #ifdef WIN32
00073 # define DRV_UNKNOWN  DRIVE_UNKNOWN  // The drive is unknown
00074 # define DRV_NO_ROOT_DIR DRIVE_NO_ROOT_DIR // The root path is invalid; for example, there is no volume is mounted at the path.
00075 # define DRV_REMOVABLE DRIVE_REMOVABLE  // The drive has removable media; for example, a floppy drive or flash card reader.
00076 # define DRV_FIXED  DRIVE_FIXED   // The drive has fixed media; for example, a hard drive, flash drive, or thumb drive.
00077 # define DRV_REMOTE  DRIVE_REMOTE  // The drive is a remote (network) drive.
00078 # define DRV_CDROM  DRIVE_CDROM   // The drive is a CD-ROM drive.
00079 # define DRV_RAMDISK  DRIVE_RAMDISK  // The drive is a RAM disk.
00080 #endif

00107 // this replaces ${var} in filename with concrete values
00108 // currently, the following variables are handled:
00109 //   ${HOME} - the home-dir, that means under unix ~  and under windows the 'my-documents'
00110 //   ${BIN} - the dir of the executable-binary
00111 //   ${SYSTEM_DATA} - data-dir of the system, that means usually /usr/share
00112 void ReplaceFileVariables(std::string& filename);

00119 #ifndef WIN32
00120 
00121 // mostly all system but Windows use case sensitive file systems
00122 // this game uses also filenames ignoring the case sensitivity
00123 // this function gives the case sensitive right name of a file
00124 // also, it replaces ${var} in the searchname
00125 // returns false if no success, true else
00126 bool GetExactFileName(const std::string& abs_searchname, std::string& filename);
00127 
00128 #else // WIN32
00129 
00130 // we don't have case sensitive file systems under windows
00131 // but we still need to replace ${var} in the searchname
00132 // returns true, if file/dir is existing and accessable, false else
00133 
00134 inline bool GetExactFileName(const std::string& abs_searchname, std::string& filename) {
00135  filename = abs_searchname;
00136  
00137  if(abs_searchname.size() == 0) {
00138   return true;
00139  }
00140  
00141  ReplaceFileVariables(filename);
00142  
00143  // Remove the ending slash, else stat will fail
00144  if (filename[filename.length()-1]== '/' || filename[filename.length()-1]== '\\')
00145   // Don't remove, if this is a root directory, else stat will fail (really crazy)
00146 #ifdef WIN32
00147   if (filename[filename.length()-2] != ':')
00148 #endif
00149    filename.erase(filename.length()-1);
00150  
00151  struct stat finfo;
00152  
00153  if(stat(Utf8ToSystemNative(filename).c_str(), &finfo) != 0) {
00154   // problems stating file
00155   return false;
00156  }
00157  
00158  // we got some info, so there is something ...
00159  return true;
00160 }
00161 #endif

00234 typedef char filemodes_t;
00235 enum {
00236  FM_DIR = 1,
00237  FM_REG = 2,
00238  FM_LNK = 4,
00239 };
00240 
00241 bool PathListIncludes(const std::list<std::string>& list, const std::string& path);
00242 
00243 // _handler has to be a functor with
00244 // bool op() ( const std::string& path )
00245 // ending pathsep is ensured if needed
00246 // if return is false, it will break
00247 // HINT: it does no GetExactFileName with the paths
00248 template<typename _handler>
00249 void ForEachSearchpath(_handler& handler) {
00250  std::list<std::string> handled_dirs;
00251  std::string path;
00252  searchpathlist::const_iterator i;
00253  
00254  {
00255   const std::string* themeDir = getSpecialSearchPathForTheme();
00256   if(themeDir) {
00257    if(!handler(*themeDir + "/")) return;
00258    handled_dirs.push_back(*themeDir);
00259   }
00260  }
00261  
00262  for(
00263   i = tSearchPaths.begin();
00264   i != tSearchPaths.end(); i++) {
00265   path = *i;
00266   if(!PathListIncludes(handled_dirs, path)) {
00267    if(!handler(path + "/")) return;
00268    handled_dirs.push_back(path);
00269   }
00270  }
00271  
00272  for(
00273   i = basesearchpaths.begin();
00274   i != basesearchpaths.end(); i++) {
00275   if(!FileListIncludesExact(&tSearchPaths, *i)) {
00276    path = *i;
00277    if(!PathListIncludes(handled_dirs, path)) {
00278     if(!handler(path + "/")) return;
00279     handled_dirs.push_back(path);
00280    }
00281   }
00282  }
00283 }
00284 
00285 
00286 // functor for ForEachSearchpath, used by FindFiles
00287 // it will search a subdir of a given searchpath for files
00288 template<typename _filehandler>
00289 class FindFilesHandler {
00290 public:
00291  const std::string& dir;
00292  const std::string& namefilter;
00293  const filemodes_t modefilter;
00294  _filehandler& filehandler;
00295  
00296  FindFilesHandler(
00297       const std::string& dir_,
00298       const std::string& namefilter_,
00299       const filemodes_t modefilter_,
00300       _filehandler& filehandler_) :
00301  dir(dir_),
00302  namefilter(namefilter_),
00303  modefilter(modefilter_),
00304  filehandler(filehandler_) {}
00305  
00306  bool operator() (const std::string& path) {
00307   std::string abs_path = path;
00308   if(!GetExactFileName(path + dir, abs_path)) return true;
00309   bool ret = true;
00310   
00311 #ifdef WIN32  // uses UTF16
00312   struct _finddata_t fileinfo;
00313   abs_path.append("/");
00314   intptr_t handle = _findfirst(Utf8ToSystemNative(abs_path + "*").c_str(), &fileinfo);
00315   while(handle > 0) {
00316    //If file is not self-directory or parent-directory
00317    if(fileinfo.name[0] != '.' || (fileinfo.name[1] != '\0' && (fileinfo.name[1] != '.' || fileinfo.name[2] != '\0'))) {
00318     if((!(fileinfo.attrib&_A_SUBDIR) && modefilter&FM_REG)
00319        || fileinfo.attrib&_A_SUBDIR && modefilter&FM_DIR)
00320      if(!filehandler(abs_path + SystemNativeToUtf8(fileinfo.name))) {
00321       ret = false;
00322       break;
00323      }
00324    }
00325    
00326    if(_findnext(handle,&fileinfo))
00327     break;
00328   }
00329   
00330   _findclose(handle);
00331 #else /* not WIN32 */
00332   
00333   std::string filename;
00334   dirent* entry;
00335   struct stat s;
00336   DIR* handle = opendir(abs_path.c_str());
00337   if(!handle) return ret;
00338   while((entry = readdir(handle)) != 0) {
00339    //If file is not self-directory or parent-directory
00340    if(entry->d_name[0] != '.' || (entry->d_name[1] != '\0' && (entry->d_name[1] != '.' || entry->d_name[2] != '\0'))) {
00341     filename = abs_path + "/" + entry->d_name;
00342     if(stat(filename.c_str(), &s) == 0)
00343      if((S_ISREG(s.st_mode) && modefilter&FM_REG)
00344         || (S_ISDIR(s.st_mode) && modefilter&FM_DIR)
00345         || (S_ISLNK(s.st_mode) && modefilter&FM_LNK))
00346       if(!filehandler(filename)) {
00347        ret = false;
00348        break;
00349       }
00350    }
00351   }
00352   closedir(handle);
00353 #endif /* WIN32 */
00354   return ret;
00355  }
00356 };
00357 
00358 // FindFiles searches for files
00359 // _handler has to be a functor with
00360 // bool op()( const std::string& abs_filename )
00361 // if it returns false, it will break
00362 template<typename _handler>
00363 void FindFiles(
00364       _handler& handler,
00365       const std::string& dir,
00366       bool absolutePath = false,
00367       const filemodes_t modefilter = -1,
00368       const std::string& namefilter = ""
00369       ) {
00370  if(namefilter != "*" && namefilter != "")
00371   warnings << "FindFiles: filter " << namefilter <<" isn't handled yet" << endl;
00372  if(absolutePath)
00373   FindFilesHandler<_handler>(dir, namefilter, modefilter, handler) ("");
00374  else {
00375   FindFilesHandler<_handler> searchpathHandler(dir, namefilter, modefilter, handler);
00376   ForEachSearchpath(searchpathHandler);
00377  }
00378 }
00379 
00380 template <typename _List, typename _CheckFct>
00381 struct GetFileList_FileListAdder {
00382  _CheckFct& checkFct;
00383  _List& filelist;
00384  GetFileList_FileListAdder(_CheckFct& f, _List& l) : checkFct(f), filelist(l) {}
00385  bool operator() (const std::string& path) {
00386   checkFct(filelist, path);
00387   return true;
00388  }
00389 };
00390 
00391 template <typename _List, typename _CheckFct>
00392 void GetFileList(
00393      _List& filelist,
00394      _CheckFct& checkFct,
00395      const std::string& dir,
00396      bool absolutePath = false,
00397      const filemodes_t modefilter = -1,
00398      const std::string& namefilter = "")
00399 {
00400  GetFileList_FileListAdder<_List,_CheckFct> adder(checkFct, filelist);
00401  FindFiles(adder, dir, absolutePath, modefilter, namefilter);
00402 }

00407 
00408 class FileListCacheIntf {
00409 public: 
00410  typedef std::string Filename;
00411  typedef std::string ObjectName;
00412  typedef std::map<Filename,ObjectName,stringcaseless> FileList;
00413 protected:
00414  Mutex mutex;
00415  FileList filelist;
00416  bool isReady; // will be set true after an update and stays always true then
00417 public:
00418  const std::string name;
00419  Event<> OnUpdateFinished;
00420  
00421  FileListCacheIntf(const std::string& n) : isReady(false), name(n) {}
00422  virtual ~FileListCacheIntf() {}
00423  
00424  // this iterator locks the filelist as long as it exists
00425  class Iterator : public ::Iterator<FileList::value_type>, public RefCounter {
00426  private:
00427   FileList::iterator it;
00428   FileListCacheIntf& filelist;
00429  public:
00430   Iterator(FileList::iterator _it, FileListCacheIntf& f) : it(_it), filelist(f) {
00431    filelist.mutex.lock();
00432   }
00433   ~Iterator() { RefCounter::uninit(); }
00434   virtual void onLastRefRemoved() {
00435    filelist.mutex.unlock();
00436   }
00437   Iterator(const Iterator& it) : RefCounter(it), it(it.it), filelist(it.filelist) {}
00438   virtual ::Iterator<FileList::value_type>* copy() const { return new Iterator(*this); }
00439   virtual bool isValid() { return it != filelist.filelist.end(); }
00440   virtual void next() { ++it; }
00441   virtual bool operator==(const ::Iterator<FileList::value_type>& other) const {
00442    const Iterator* o = dynamic_cast<const Iterator*> (&other);
00443    return o && it == o->it;
00444   }
00445   virtual FileList::value_type get() { return *it; }
00446   
00447   typedef ::Iterator<FileList::value_type>::Ref Ref;
00448  };
00449  
00450  Iterator::Ref begin() { return new Iterator(filelist.begin(), *this); }
00451  void add(const FileList::value_type& o) { Mutex::ScopedLock lock(mutex); filelist.insert(o); }
00452  bool includes(const Filename& fn) { Mutex::ScopedLock lock(mutex); return filelist.find(fn) != filelist.end(); }
00453  bool autoComplete(AutocompleteRequest& request);
00454  bool ready() { Mutex::ScopedLock lock(mutex); return isReady; }
00455  virtual void update() = 0; // will be run in an own thread and should lock as short as possible (in best case only for the swap of the old/new list)
00456 };
00457 
00458 template <typename _CheckFct> // asume that _CheckFct will be static anyway - makes it a bit simpler - just change if needed
00459 class FileListCache : public FileListCacheIntf {
00460 protected:
00461  const std::string dir;
00462  const bool absolutePath;
00463  const filemodes_t modefilter;
00464  const std::string namefilter;
00465 public:
00466  // Note: slightly different default values from FindFiles (modefilter is FM_REG here)
00467  FileListCache(const std::string& _name,
00468       const std::string& _dir,
00469       bool _absPath = false,
00470       const filemodes_t _modefilter = FM_REG,
00471       const std::string& _namefilter = "")
00472  : FileListCacheIntf(_name), dir(_dir), absolutePath(_absPath), modefilter(_modefilter), namefilter(_namefilter) {}
00473  
00474  virtual void update() {
00475   static _CheckFct fct;
00476   FileList newList;
00477   GetFileList(newList, fct, dir, absolutePath, modefilter, namefilter);
00478   {
00479    Mutex::ScopedLock lock(mutex);
00480    filelist.swap(newList);
00481    isReady = true;
00482   }
00483   OnUpdateFinished.pushToMainQueue(EventData(this));
00484  }
00485 };

00489 // File pointer to SDL RWops conversion

00491 
00492 // Platform-independent stat() - use S_ISREG( st.st_mode ) and S_ISDIR( st.st_mode ) on stat struct
00493 inline bool StatFile( const std::string & file, struct stat * st )
00494 {
00495  std::string fname = GetFullFileName( file );
00496  std::string exactfname;
00497  if( ! GetExactFileName( fname, exactfname ) )
00498   return false;
00499  if( stat( Utf8ToSystemNative(fname).c_str(), st ) != 0 )
00500   return false;
00501  
00502  return true;
00503 }
